title: Compound Poisson process
summary: A compound Poisson process is a continuous-time (random) stochastic process with jumps. The jumps arrive randomly according to a Poisson process and the size of the jumps is also random, with a specified probability distribution. A compound Poisson process, parameterised by a rate λ > 0 {\displaystyle \lambda >0} and jump size distribution G, is a process { Y ( t ) : t ≥ 0 } {\displaystyle \{\,Y(t):t\geq 0\,\}} given by
